title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 20, ch. II, subch. A, art. 3, pt. 132 - New York Adjusted Gross Income of a Nonresident Individual
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 20, ch. II, subch. A, art. 3, pt. 132 - New York Adjusted Gross Income of a Nonresident Individual

State Regulations

New York Adjusted Gross Income Defined (§ 132.1)

Income and Deductions from New York State Sources (§ 132.2 to 132.11)

Income and Deductions Partly from New York State Sources (§ 132.12 to 132.14)

Methods of Allocating Income and Deductions from Sources Within and Without New York State (§ 132.15 to 132.25)

Husband and Wife (§ 132.26)

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 20, ch. II, subch. A, art. 3, pt. 132

Statutory authority: Tax Law, §§171, 697

Except for sections
132.19
and
132.24, this Part does not reflect amendments to the Tax Law made by the Tax Reform
and Reduction Act of 1987 (chapter 28 of the Laws of 1987) and certain other
amendments. State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
